sentences.english: You want to keep your kick tight and small with slight knee bend.
sentences.chinese: 你要做到的是双膝微曲的紧张踢腿。

sentences.english: Drop your knees down to the right without allowing your body to follow.
sentences.chinese: 将双膝向右侧放下，同时身体上部不能随之右转。

sentences.english: Similar to a Backscratcher, bend your knees so the Skis will be behind you.
sentences.chinese: 和背挠类似，弯曲双膝，这样你的雪板就在你的后面。

sentences.english: In your turn, you should make sure to move your ankles and knees further and further towards the inside of the turn.
sentences.chinese: 转弯途中，双踝和双膝的动作要越来越朝向内弯。

sentences.english: I knelt down and he spoke to me.
sentences.chinese: 我双膝跪下，他还对我说话。

sentences.english: I can catch the last shout abuse, or knees to detain him.
sentences.chinese: 我可以追过去破口大骂，或者双膝跪地挽留他。

sentences.english: A second thing you can do is to walk with your knees bent a little bit.
sentences.chinese: 你能做的第二件事就是双膝稍微弯曲一点走路。

sentences.english: By tipping both your ankle and your knee, you are sure to get your ski on its edge.
sentences.chinese: 通过双踝和双膝的侧偏，确保是在用刃滑行。

sentences.english: She barked elbows and knees on the cold-water basin .
sentences.chinese: 她的双肘和双膝碰到冷水盆。

sentences.english: He crawled to window, raised his head and looked in .
sentences.chinese: 他弯下双膝，徐徐爬到窗下，抬起头向室内望去。

sentences.english: When the brain signed off, Tesla's knees buckled .
sentences.chinese: 当主脑退出连线时，泰斯拉的双膝瞬间软了下来。

sentences.english: He drops to his knees and lays in his lover's arms.
sentences.chinese: 随后，他双膝跪地，跌倒在爱人的怀里。

sentences.english: He picked himself up and walked on with weak knees.
sentences.chinese: 他站了起来，双膝无力地继续向前走。

sentences.english: Keep your knees slightly apart, with your thighbones parallel.
sentences.chinese: 双膝微微分开，大腿骨相互平行。

sentences.english: Military personnel for whom knees kneel?Man;
I fall to my knees, I cry and I cry.
sentences.chinese: 双膝跪倒的偶，疾苦流涕。

definition: to kneel down/to sink to one's knees/to grovel
to land/to touch the ground/also pr. [zhuo2 di4]
knee/(Internet slang) to kneel down (in admiration)
to draw together/to place side by side (e.g. one's fingers, two halves of a torn sheet of paper etc)
to bow/to bend at the waist
to lean over/to bend over/to stoop/to bow
